name: Beverly Wilshire Beverly Hills (A Four Seasons Hotel)

reviews.text: A stay at the Beverly Wilshire was a very enjoyable experience, and though expensive, this hotel thoroughly justifies the expense by delivering top quality service and product throughout.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Our Beverly Suite was a classically and simply furnished one bedroom suite on the 11th floor, equipped with a large walk-in wardrobe and spacious bathroom. It had everything we needed and was so well air-conditioned that the temperature was always perfect. The large terrace gave us a view of the Hollywood hills, while with doors closed the rooms were quiet and peaceful. The bed and bedding was so comfortable that we slept very soundly.
reviews.title: What a way to start our US trip :)

reviews.text: We didn't eat in very much, but both Cut and Boulevard looked excellent. We did enjoy a poolside snack which was very good and a drink in the Boulevard Lounge which had a great atmosphere. Our room service breakfasts were extremely tasty and very quickly delivered, as was everything we ordered by room service. The “Sidebar” bar was a really great place to enjoy a cocktail or two, or have a snack. The bar staff were really friendly and efficient and the drinks were mixed with care and attention.
reviews.title: Best night's sleep.
What a hotel to make you feel special..........
reviews.text: Check-in and check-out were very easy and efficiently handled. The front desk staff were helpful, informative and well-organized, as were the Bellmen and Valets. Every member of staff we met was very helpful.

reviews.text: As you’d expect the clientele at this hotel are quite upscale and international. There were many events taking place at the hotel in meeting rooms and ballrooms in the extensive property. Despite all this, we were never ignored or overlooked in any way, even on a hectic Saturday night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 2 nights at the start of our grand tour of the west coast and what a way to start ! We thought the hotel itself was fantastic, the decor, the cleanliness, the bar, the pool and gym and the room were all top notch and well worth the money. We were upgraded on arrival which was fantastic and our room was great. Concierge organised dinner for us and the house car (Rolls Royce Phantom) took us and felt like filmstars as we arrived!
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.text: The only thing if anything, which was slightly disappointing, was, we felt that unless you tipped every single person who ever even so much as smiled at you, the service dropped. We're English and not so used to doing it and perhaps didn't tip the right people enough money and the second night we were there, the town car "wasn't available", the service was slow in the bar and we couldn't get on the guest list of the bar we wanted to go to. Perhaps our imagination. However on the whole, it was a fantastic stay and the treat really lived up to expectation
reviews.title: out of this world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here for 4 nights. All I can say is wow wow wow! From the moment we pulled up till the day we checked out we had fabulous service. Everyone was so helpful and friendly and couldnt do enough, nothing was a problem. The concierge were great, they supplied us with bandaids, directions, earplugs, Im sure if we had asked for a giraffe they would have delivered! It may a little pricy but so well worth it, no negatives at all about this place we would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: The rooms again could use freshening up. They were dreary and drab. The spa, however, was the most beautiful spa that I have ever visited. It was just stunning and serene. How could I not like a spa that has very thing chocolate imbedded with raisins? The treatment was good but could have been better. The spa is VERY expensive. The Amex platinum credit of $100 barely covered any service. I had a 30 minute foot massage and still had to pay $15 which is ridiculous. But it was beautiful.

reviews.text: The pool is old world Hollywood and elegant. The staff could not be more gracious. When I realized that I had forgotten a scrunchie for my hair in the jacuzzi, the staff member immediately, found one for me. Above and beyond service is clearly their motto.

It was delicious. The Blvd. also has an adorable candy bar with homemade treats which are for sale by the bag. Sampling is free. I highly, recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many reviewers write that they were made to feel special or treated like royalty, but it really is true. From the moment we arrived we were treated like we are the most special guests ever to stay at this magnificent and historical property! We are not anyone important, but I assure you that the Beverly Wilshire staff could not and would not have made any celebrity or the President of the U.S. feel more welcome than we were made to feel. Our room was spacious and beautiful with a great view. The bathroom was very roomy and done in gorgeous dark marble with double sinks allowing for plenty of room for my wife's "stuff" as well as mine, and a separate shower and a whirlpool tub. We did not find anything about the room "old fashioned" or outdated! As guests, we tend to wander around thinking who might be there, or who might have stayed there or been there for whatever party, and surely there are multitudes of VIPs who have, but the staff don't act like there has been anyone there more important than you. The food options in the hotel are all excellent, including In-Room dining and THEBlvd. hotel restaurant and Wolfgang Puck's CUT steakhouse. The location is second to none with Rodeo Drive right out the front door, and a lot of great shopping and dining within a few blocks right around the hotel. All in all, it has been our very best hotel experience, and we have been blessed to have stayed in a number of "luxury" properties on our travels. The staff and management of this hotel truly care about your experience while you are a guest.
reviews.title: WE COULD HAVE WON OSCARS LAST MONTH AND NOT BEEN TREATED ANY BETTER!!!!

reviews.text: It was my mother's first visit to the US and a friend recommended that we stay at the Beverly Wilshire. This trip was her early birthday present and it ranks as one of the memorable and enjoyable trips - due in very large part to the hotel. Service throughout is excellent. The room is not the most modern but it is very comfortable, spacious, has lots of closet space and a large bathroom. Location is unrivalled - right in the centre of Beverly Hills, across the road from Rodeo Drive and with many restaurants nearby. Would definitely stay here again if we return to LA and highly recommend it to my family and friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay for My Mother's Early Birthday Present

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to the west coast of America at the end of March visiting Los Angeles, Las Vegas and San Francisco. We stayed at the Beverly Wilshire for 5 nights whilst in LA and found this to be the best hotel of our stay. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty by the staff - in fact every member of staff that we came into contact with said hello and were friendly even if we passed them in the corridor. The hotel was extremely clean, tidy and had a high standard of decor. Our room was delightful and we had a balcony overlooking the swimming pool. We couldn't fault the room for cleanliness and the bed was extremely comfortable meaning that we had an excellent night sleep. We used the swimming pool and sun loungers - again all of which were clean, tidy and manned by attentive friendly staff. We had breakfast at the hotel several times and the food was delicious and the portions sizes were generous. We found that this hotel concentrated on the small details which included a complimentary newspaper each day and a good selection of spa products in the bathroom which were regularly replenished. The location of the hotel was exceptional and we thoroughly enjoyed our time in Beverly Hills and LA. We would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone else. The only thing that they could improve on would be the selection of meals on offer in the restaurants for vegetarians as the menu focus was very much on meat. We did visit one of the bars on our first evening and enjoyed a cocktail and bar snacks.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
